description: Prior Approval (class AA) for the construction of an additional storey above the existing two-storey building
decision_conditions:
<p>The developer must notify the local planning authority of the 
completion of the development as soon as reasonably practicable after 
completion; and that notification must be in writing and includeâ€”(i) the
 name of the developer;(ii) the address of the dwellinghouse; and(iii) 
the date of completion.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In accordance with conditions 3(d)
 and 3(e) Class AA of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country 
Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as 
amended).</p><p><br></p>

<p>All new works, and works of making good to the retained fabric, 
whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original 
work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, 
composition, form, colour, finish and profile, and in the case of 
brickwork, facebond and pointing.
</p><p><br></p><p>
REASON: In the interests of visual appearance. <br></p><p><br></p>

<p>Prior to commencement, the developer must submit to the local 
planning authority for approval in writing a report for the management 
of the construction of the development, which sets out the proposed 
development hours of operation and how any adverse impact of noise, 
dust, vibration and traffic on adjoining owners or occupiers will be 
mitigated.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure effects are adequately managed to 
protect neighbouring amenity in accordance with condition 3(b) of Class 
AA of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General 
Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).</p><p><br></p>

<p>The development shall be undertaken in full accordance with the 
conditions set out in the relevant part of Schedule 2 of the Town and 
Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 
(as amended).</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To comply with the requirements of the Town 
and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 
2015 (as amended). </p><p><br></p>

<p>The development hereby granted must be completed within a period of 3
 years starting with the date this prior approval is granted.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON:
 In accordance with Condition 3c of Class AA of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of 
the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) 
Order 2015 (as amended).</p><p><br></p>
